name: A. Rectangle Puzzle
statement:
You are given two rectangles on a plane. The centers of both rectangles
are located in the origin of coordinates (meaning the center of the
rectangle’s symmetry). The first rectangle’s sides are parallel to the
coordinate axes: the length of the side that is parallel to the axis,
equals , the length of the side that is parallel to the axis, equals .
The second rectangle can be obtained by rotating the first rectangle
relative to the origin of coordinates by angle . Your task is to find
the area of the region which belongs to both given rectangles. This
region is shaded in the picture.
